185977497.review:
Smite es un juego que me ha acompañado durante 12 años, comenzando con Smite 1, y honestamente, no puedo estar más contento con la evolución que ha tenido a lo largo del tiempo. Cuando empecé a jugar Smite 1, me fascinó su propuesta innovadora: un MOBA con perspectiva en tercera persona que te sumergía completamente en el campo de batalla. Desde el primer momento, la sensación de controlar a dioses y personajes mitológicos de distintas culturas fue algo único y emocionante.

Recuerdo con cariño las horas que pasé aprendiendo las mecánicas, explorando el roster inicial de dioses y disfrutando de los modos de juego que ofrecía Smite 1. Era un título que, a pesar de sus limitaciones gráficas comparado con los estándares actuales, tenía un encanto especial que me mantuvo enganchado durante años.

Ahora, con el salto a Smite 2, tengo que decir que estoy absolutamente encantado con los cambios que han realizado. El cambio de motor gráfico ha sido un soplo de aire fresco, llevando los visuales del juego a un nivel completamente nuevo. Los mapas se sienten más vivos, los detalles en los diseños de los dioses son impresionantes, y la fluidez en el combate ha mejorado considerablemente. Es evidente el esfuerzo que los desarrolladores han puesto para modernizar la experiencia sin perder la esencia que hizo grande al juego original.

Además de los cambios gráficos, también he notado mejoras en la jugabilidad y en los sistemas del juego. Los ajustes en el balance de los dioses, la introducción de nuevas mecánicas y la ampliación de los modos de juego han hecho que Smite 2 se sienta fresco y emocionante. Todo esto sin mencionar el compromiso continuo de los desarrolladores con la comunidad, que sigue siendo un pilar fundamental del éxito del juego.

Por supuesto, pasar de Smite 1 a Smite 2 no ha sido un viaje sin desafíos. Al principio, adaptarme a los cambios fue un proceso, pero ahora no puedo imaginar volver a la versión anterior. Los avances han sido para mejor, y cada partida en Smite 2 me recuerda por qué me enamoré de esta franquicia hace más de una década.

En definitiva, Smite ha sido y sigue siendo una experiencia que valoro enormemente. Desde mis inicios en Smite 1 hasta mi actual entusiasmo por Smite 2, este juego ha sido una parte importante de mi vida como jugador. Si estás buscando un MOBA con acción intensa, estrategia y una presentación espectacular, no puedo recomendarlo lo suficiente. ¡Anímate a unirte y experimentar esta evolución por ti mismo! ¡Nos vemos en el campo de batalla!

185768574.review:
Recently I am installing Smite 2, the gameplay of Smite 2 basically same as Smite 1. The only differences is graphic, tbh Smite 1 graphic way better for me and you know what... if you have mid-low end PC/laptop, do not even bother to install Smite 2 as the game will give you bad performance as it using UE5.

500+ hours playing Smite 1. I played with high ping at that too (I am from South East Asia). It shows that I loved this game. The only MOBA I played because I like the concept: 3rd person, myth/god/pantheon creatures. But sadly nowadays the game is only for NA-EU players only as the servers are dead except NA and EU. I am actually miss good old days when Asia server still full of players.

I actually having slight hope if anyone playing Asia server in Smite 2... you know what? HAHA. I am queuing for 1h still got no match found. Smite 2 already dead outside NA and EU. It is same as Smite 1. I am uninstalling both Smite for good as the game basically for NA and EU players only, the devs also already stop adding content for Smite 1, and I am 100% sure they will stop their support soon for Smite 1. If only company like Riot own Smite, instead of Hi-Rez...

That is from me. I am quitting. Thanks Smite for all those journey and the memories.

I would leave this review for Smite 2, but that involves having the god awful thing on my computer.

Smite 1 used to be great, but they just kept messing everything up in terms of nerfs, gear balances, etc.
Then, on top of all the other BS Hi-Rez YET AGAIN scraps something decent to move on to the next cash grab. 

Taking the exact same game and reselling it as another version is disgusting. 

Smite 1 and Smite 2 are the exact same game. The game would somehow be less of an obvious cash grab if the company came out and said "We just want more money". 

That's all before we even get the skins and money spent on the first game that DOES NOT transfer over. 
I've seen the devs respond with the most idiotic statements "Oh, we're REAL sorry, but you can still get new stuff!"
Seriously? 
Hi-Rez as a whole is just scummy and disgusting. 

Do not download this game, Do not waste your time. DO NOT play Smite 2, unless you're eagerly awaiting the day hi-Rez dumps that too and asks for you to buy in to ANOTHER game.

185628626.review: SMITE é um MOBA inovador que se destaca por sua perspectiva em terceira pessoa, oferecendo uma experiência única em comparação com outros jogos do gênero. Com uma vasta seleção de deuses e mitologias de diversas culturas, o jogo permite aos jogadores escolher entre uma variedade de personagens, cada um com habilidades distintas e estratégias próprias. A jogabilidade é dinâmica, combinando ação intensa com elementos táticos, o que exige habilidade tanto no controle individual quanto no trabalho em equipe. SMITE é uma excelente opção para quem busca uma experiência MOBA com uma abordagem fresca e emocionante.

185591777.review:
Smite fue el juego del genero MOBA que mas disfrute estos casi 8 años, Desde finales de season 3 pude disfrutar este maravilloso juego hasta el día de hoy que salio SMITE2 Free to Play. Fueron los mejores años compartiendo con gente que nunca pensé que iba a poder conocer, pero algo no es bonito por que dura para siempre y ya no le dedicare tantas horas a Smite u otro juego de Hi-Rez Studios.
Smite, Paladins y Realm Royale pudieron ser mejor de lo que fueron pero por decisiones de los altos mandos de Hi-Rez Studios nunca llegaron a su máximo potencial, espero que SMITE2 sea un buen juego y que rompa con el ciclo de sus predecesores. La relación amor/odio que tuve con este juego no creo que la experimente con otro juego y tampoco creo que encuentre a mejor compañía de la que encontré aquí.
Sin mas que decir, Gracias Hi-Rez por este juego y estos ultimos 8 años

185525106.review:
I love the game of Smite. Smite for a long time was balanced on a knife's edge where increasing any one item's numbers by even 5-10% could break the game and send items straight into the meta, and then Hirez started taking very brave leaps in balance. Allowing you to buy as many glyphed items as you want instead of just one. Double the damage of Mystical mail. Reintroduce Hide of the Nemean Lion even though hunter mains and duel grandmasters hated it. Straight up based. And somehow, through all the unhinged ideas they cooked up in an underground meth lab, the game ended up fairly well balanced. And you can really tell its well balanced when a player can make basically any god work in any lane as long as the player themselves has the skill to make it work. It's worth your time to learn item builds and god kits, all their individual quirks and ability chains, like how Chang'e casts her abilities faster if you activate them in a certain order, even though it doesn't say that at all. It's an amazingly gratifying experience to figure out all these little things and use them to your advantage. And when you meet another player who's tuned in on the exact same level? Things get interesting. This game is extremely engaging, and almost the only game that can keep my Dark Souls trained, Risk of Rain tested, difficulty junkie brain on it's toes these days. I love the game of Smite.

But I hate the playerbase. Every single game has "that guy". Every. Single. Game. Sometimes you get a lobby full of them. Writing about the specifics of their "endeavors" wont do them any justice at all. There is no logical thinking behind what they do. Just complete, uninhibited, perfect narcissism. Zero empathy for the other 9/5 players of the game, zero guilt felt for ruining the lobby. You do not matter to them. Fortunately, games are only 25-35 minutes on average, because if I had to live with these people any longer than that, I would end up being investigated by higher authorities. If you play this game, you understand. If you decide to start playing this game, you'll know when you see them. 

I will keep playing this game for a long time to come. It's simply perfect for me. I can understand what people mean when they describe Team Fortress 2 as a timeless classic. This is that game to me. Endlessly engaging, always challenging. I learn something new about the game, get that little bit better after every match. I love the game of Smite.

And lastly, my message to anybody who currently plays the game.
If you find yourself saying:
"game is unwinnable" Have foresight. The gods that are spam laughing on tower line at 15 minutes probably get rolled at 25. The match isn't over until a titan is dead, and 50% of the teams that deny a surrender vote go on to win the game. 

"I'm not having fun" Well, two things. First, think bigger than yourself. Sometimes you're the pigeon, sometimes you're the statue. You cant stomp every game. But more importantly, losing never prevented you from having fun. It's a choice. You only stopped having fun when you gave up and checked out. 

"get me out/go next" You are the common denominator in your bad games. The only thing that'll be different about your next game is that you'll be bitter you're coming off a loss. If you refuse to participate when you're seriously challenged, you'll always be a weak player with an exploitable mental. Instead, lean forward and strap in for a hard game. Makes it all the more satisfying to win in the end.

I found this game to be unbelivably fun. It's the ONLY competitive game I've seen where every type of gamer would love this. 

The casual modes are great for chilling, the 3v3 mode is an intense action strategy experience, ranked duels are difficult and the other modes are great too.

In fact, I'd say the "moba" 5v5 conquest map is the weakest part of the experience. 

Look at the reviews- this game is so damn fun. Don't let it consume you. Looking forward to smite 2.

185064667.review:
SEMPLICEMENTE INGIOCABILE

So che il titolo può spaventare,ma è la pura verità. Smite nel 2025 è oramai ingiocabile,e chi lo afferma è un giocatore che ha 2488 ore (con il profilo Steam,ed forse altrettante con quello di Epic). Se da un lato lo reputo un Ottimo MOBA,dall'altro il sistema di matchmaking lo distrugge completamente. Il solo modo di poterci giocare è facendo squadra (i cosidetti Premade) con altri players,altrimenti preparati a perdere la quasi totalità di partite. Nonostante l'esperienza,le ore giocate ed una discreta abilità,il gioco continua a creare squadre sbilanciate all'ennesima potenza,raggruppandoti spesso e volentieri,con giocatori alle prime armi e facendoti trovare contro squadre già belle e formate. E la prova è proprio li! Quelle volte in cui mi unisco ad amici,formando un team da 5,il gioco ci abbina a players poco abili o neofiti,finendo per concludere la partita con divari di 30-40 o più kills;inutile dire (parlando almeno di arena) che la partita finisce persino prima dei 10 minuti,dopo i quali è possibile arrendersi. Perciò il grado di soddisfazione su questo gioco è pari a 0;se provi a giocare da solo,la sconfitta è assicurata,quando invece giochi con amici la partita dura meno di 10 minuti,con gli avversari che nemmeno escono dalla base. 
Quindi io mi chiedo...quale senso ha giocare a Smite nel 2025? Sinceramente non riesco a trovare motivazioni,poichè come ho detto,nonostante sia un buon gioco,il sistema di matchmaking ti porta ad abbandonarlo dopo le prime partite;Quindi,a te che stai leggendo e che vuoi provarlo,ti dico di non farlo,altrimenti entra in qualche Community,cerca altri players e fai squadra,ma evita assolutamente di giocare da solo

P.S.
Per coloro i quali potessero rispondere che non hanno problemi,che il matchmaking non è malvagio etc...io parlo di me,dei miei profili,basta andare a vedere gli score delle ultime partite per rendersi conto delle partite che gioco,quindi tutto quello che ho scritto si basa su fatti,e non sulle parole di un giocatore frustrato che non riesce a vincere una partita. 
Sinceramente dopo 8 o 9 anni ancora non ho capito il criterio di matchmaking,dato che dopo forse le prime decine di livelli,il gioco comincia a combinarti con squadre da incubo;tanto è vero che ho abbandonato questo profilo e ne ho creato uno nuovo su Epic e...voilà! Comincio a giocare,i primi giorni o forse settimane il gioco va bene...ed ad un certo punto ti ritrovi di nuovo a giocare ontro premade,e questo capita su ogni modalità,che sia Conquest,Slash o persino Arena

184911146.review:
"A refreshing twist on the MOBA genre!"

SMITE offers a unique take on the MOBA experience by bringing the action down to a third-person perspective. This change completely transforms how you approach the game, making positioning, aiming, and map awareness feel much more immersive and dynamic compared to traditional top-down MOBAs.

One of the highlights of SMITE is its diverse roster of gods and mythological figures. Whether you want to play as Zeus hurling lightning bolts, Thor smashing enemies with his hammer, or Anubis unleashing a devastating ultimate, there’s something for everyone. The developers continuously add new gods and updates, which keeps the gameplay fresh.

The game modes are also a plus. From classic 5v5 Conquest to more casual modes like Arena and Joust, there’s a mode for every kind of player. The variety ensures you can switch things up depending on your mood, whether you’re looking for something competitive or just some quick, fun matches.

While SMITE’s learning curve can be steep for newcomers, it’s rewarding once you get the hang of it. The community can be hit or miss at times, but that’s pretty standard for most competitive games.

Overall, SMITE is a fantastic MOBA with its own flavor. The mix of mythology, fast-paced combat, and strategic gameplay makes it stand out in the genre. If you’re looking for a different kind of MOBA experience, give SMITE a try—you might just find your new favorite game!

184699701.review: A good game with interesting strategy elements. Lots of teamwork, so real-life friends makes a big difference (matchmaking is a bit haphazard otherwise: you'll stomp your enemy or vice versa with little in-between). Used to be updated frequently, often changing a large portion of what strategy will be effective. The sequel is entering beta testing now, so it doesn't get many updates and they tend to be minor. Still, I started playing a bit over a decade ago (not through Steam) and still enjoy it.

184154401.review:
mite stands out in the crowded multiplayer online battle arena (MOBA) genre by delivering a unique, third-person perspective that breathes new life into the formula popularized by games like League of Legends and Dota 2. Developed by Hi-Rez Studios, this action-packed title invites players to step into the roles of gods, goddesses, and other mythological figures across a variety of cultures.

Gameplay
The most striking feature of Smite is its third-person perspective, which completely changes how the game feels. Instead of the traditional top-down camera, players experience battles from behind their chosen deity, which enhances immersion and makes aiming skills, dodging, and positioning feel more visceral and engaging.

The game offers multiple modes, such as the classic Conquest for fans of strategic team play, Arena for quick and chaotic battles, and Assault, a single-lane mode for more unpredictable fun. The diversity ensures there's something for everyone, whether you're a casual player or a competitive enthusiast.

Gods and Mythology
One of Smite's most captivating features is its roster of over 100 playable gods and mythological figures. From Zeus to Anubis to Kukulkan, the game pulls from a vast array of pantheons, each lovingly designed with unique abilities that reflect their mythological backgrounds. The attention to detail in their animations, lore, and abilities is commendable, adding layers of depth for players interested in mythology.

184103809.review: SMITE is a fantastic third-person MOBA that brings a fresh twist to the genre. The unique perspective adds an exciting layer of action, as you control your gods and heroes directly in the midst of battle. The game offers a wide variety of gods from different mythologies, each with unique abilities and playstyles. The team-based gameplay is strategic and requires excellent coordination and communication, which makes every match exciting. The visuals are vibrant, and the maps are well-designed, offering a variety of challenges. SMITE’s frequent updates and events keep the game fresh. If you enjoy MOBAs but want something a bit different, SMITE is definitely worth checking out.

Maybe I'll change my review if they fix this mess.
